channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous very cracked pathway covered in weeds. Residents slipping and falling, 13th May
item.description:
Dangerous pathway at 1 Buttercross Lane. In front of driveway all around and at the side of the pathway the road is severely uneven and cracked. Someone from Roberts Road has fallen due to the uneven pathway covered with weeds. A dog walker also slipped with their dog running into the road. This has been reported before but the weeds are growing thicker due to large cracks.Pleaee can this be treated urgently. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Buttercross Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Several potholes that look like have been fixed but are actually still as bad making the road bumpy and uneven, 13th May
item.description:
It has been an ongoing problem on this piece of road for several months - just before you turn corner approaching springbank view new homes - you can only drive in second gear. The potholes have been filled poorly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked, 12th May
item.description:
Hi, This drain is blocked and causes a large build up of water in the road Regards, Josh

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty Traffic Lights, 12th May
item.description:
Traffic lights outside Blossom Lodge Nursery on Hales Road are faulty. They are continually being triggered from green-to-red, without pedestrians pressing the button to cross. The lights are green for approximately 10 seconds only and then return to red, alongside which, the pedestrian 'beeping' is also being triggered and is therefore playing at regular intervals. This short green-to-red cycle has been continual throughout this evening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Junction at end of Greenhills Rd into Sandy Lane and Moorend Road, 12th May
item.description:
Junction of three roads.Greenhills Road/Sandy Lane/Moorend Road. Traffic travelling on Moorend Road DO NOT heed the road markings to give way,and turn RIGHT into the path of traffic turning right into Sandy Lane from Greenhills Road..This is a dangerous black spot could results in the traffic turning right into Sandy lane being hit by vehicles failing to give way.A larger GIVE WAY or STOP sign at the entry into Greenhills Road from Moorend Road would make traffic slow down at this blind bend..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moorend Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Path has been diverted for years with locked gate because of deer. Now seems to have a structure built on it, 12th May
item.description:
Footpath, diverted between: SO 93615 18724 East 393615 North 218724 SO 94542 18535 East 393542 North 218535 Now appears to be built on at the end nearest Leckhampton Lane. Looks like existing structure has been replaced and extended recently. Long and Lat are from OS Maps app and may be out by a few metres

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crippetts Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead seagull, 12th May
item.description:
There's a large dead seagull on the easterly corner where Brook Road meets Tewkesbury Road, on the inside of the pavement where the gap is for pedestrians to cross.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Pavement is breaking up - the hole is getting bigger, 12th May
item.description:
Outside 4 larkhay road, there is a pot hole that needs fixing. You came and fixed one, but missed this one as on the day you came out it was bin day and our bins were covering it. it would be great if you can take the loose stones away and fill this one please..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Larkhay Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Cycle path is overgrown, 12th May
item.description:
The cycle path from the bottom of the park to golden valley underpasse is overgrown . You can only just pass through in single file and have to duck under low hanging branches .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged Access Panel - possibly Severn Trent main sewer., 11th May
item.description:
Just up the road, in the centre of the road, from number 31. I first logged this on 10/8/23 - DMC001049 and since via the new FixMyStreet service - 5235798. I was surprised to receive an e-mail today saying that 'this enquiry has been addressed' - because it certainly hasn't. It's been faulty for 9 months, and is looking more and more damaged.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmead Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
